title.narrative: 5.1 CP SOCIAL NORMS

description.narrative: Communities, families and boys and girls themselves have strengthened capacity to protect children and women from violence and exploitation and to eliminate harmful practices (changing social norms)., which contributes to Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, increased numbers of children in Somalia are protected from all forms of abuse, neglect and exploitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities, families and boys and girls themselves have strengthened capacity to protect children and women from violence andexploitation and to eliminate harmful practices (changing social norms).

description.narrative: The child protection programme in Somalia empowers communities to prevent violence and abuse against children and supports those communities to provide services for children through community-based mechanisms. As such, the program embarked on a wide-ranging effort to educate and raise the awareness within communities to stamp out practices, including – but not confined to - female genital mutilation, child marriage, gender-based violence, and child labour.;;;;;;;;;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2021

actual.value: 2020:346 new CPCs established and engaged in responding to CP issues
